inclusion.criterion: Healthy subjects as established by medical history and history-directed physical examination before entering into the study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Previously completed routine childhood vaccinations against diphtheria, tetanus and pertussis diseases according to the recommended vaccination schedule at the time.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Females of childbearing potential at the time of study entry are required to have a negative pregnancy test prior to administration of the dose of vaccine and are required to be abstinent or use adequate contraceptive precautions for one month prior to vaccination.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subjects also are required to agree to continue such precautions for two months after vaccination.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Administration of a pre-school booster of DTP vaccine within the previous 5 years
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: The patient has a history of atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome, but it is not clear if this would affect their eligibility for the study.
